question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Race Condition] Can multiple processor instances running concurrently read and write the same progress_file_path simultaneously, causing progress corruption or lost updates when one instance overwrites another's progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [File System Attack] Can an attacker with filesystem access replace the progress file with a malicious JSON payload during the window between reading (line 79) and parsing (line 80), causing arbitrary deserialization or denial of service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Integer Overflow] In line 77 where expected_end_version is calculated as starting_version + transactions_count, can integer overflow occur if transactions_count is near u64::MAX, causing the backfiller to skip vast amounts of data or loop indefinitely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Integer Overflow] At line 69 where ending_version is calculated as starting_version.unwrap_or(0) + c, can this overflow when starting_version is large and transactions_count (c) pushes the sum beyond u64::MAX? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Logic Bug] At line 92 where expected_starting_version = max(starting_version, progress_file.version), if progress_file.version is corrupted to be higher than the actual ledger height, will the backfiller request non-existent transactions and fail silently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Early Exit Vulnerability] At lines 98-102, if expected_starting_version >= expected_end_version causes exit(0), can an attacker manipulate the progress file to set version higher than ending_version, preventing the backfiller from ever running? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Chain ID Validation] At line 119, chain_id is validated against metadata.chain_id, but if file_store_operator.get_file_store_metadata() returns stale or cached data, can transactions from the wrong chain be processed, leading to state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [TOCTOU Bug] Between verifying storage bucket existence (line 116) and getting metadata (line 118), can the bucket be deleted or modified by another process, causing the unwrap() at line 118 to panic despite the verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Panic Risk] At line 118, get_file_store_metadata().unwrap() will panic if metadata doesn't exist despite bucket verification, can this be exploited to crash the backfiller by race condition or misconfiguration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Directory Traversal] Can an attacker provide a malicious progress_file_path (line 87-88) containing path traversal sequences (../) to write progress files to arbitrary filesystem locations, potentially overwriting critical system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Panic on Unwrap] At line 153, grpc_stream.take().expect() will panic if stream is None, can this be triggered by calling backfill() twice or in validation_mode, causing denial of service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Panic on Frame] At lines 154-159, the code expects first frame and unwraps response, can a malicious fullnode send an empty stream or different message type to crash the backfiller? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Protocol Violation] At lines 162-164, if the init frame signal type is not StatusType::Init, the code bails, but can a Byzantine fullnode send StatusType::Init multiple times or at wrong positions to cause state confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Stream Validation] At line 158, response.unwrap() assumes response is always Some, but can the gRPC stream send None responses intermixed with valid ones, causing panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Resource Exhaustion] At line 173, tasks are spawned up to backfill_processing_task_count without bounds checking, can an attacker set this to millions causing memory exhaustion and node crash? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Channel Overflow] At line 143, the channel has capacity 1000, but if workers are slow and sender is fast, can this cause unbounded memory growth in the channel buffer leading to OOM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Arc/Mutex Contention] At line 149, finished_starting_versions is wrapped in Arc<Mutex>, can extreme lock contention when many tasks try to insert simultaneously cause deadlock or starvation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Data Integrity] At line 189, the check ensures transactions.len() == 1000, but can a malicious fullnode send 999 valid transactions + 1 corrupted one, passing the length check but corrupting the file store? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Integer Validation] At line 191, transactions[0].version % 1000 == 0 is checked, but can version overflow or wraparound cause modulo to pass incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Off-by-One Error] At line 194, the loop uses 'ide' (likely meant to be 'idx'), can this typo cause incorrect version validation allowing gaps or duplicates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Version Continuity] At lines 195-198, version continuity is checked, but can integer overflow in transactions[0].version + ide as u64 cause wraparound accepting invalid sequences? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Panic on Upload] At lines 204-207, unwrap() is called on upload_transaction_batch, causing panic on any upload failure, can network issues or storage errors be exploited to repeatedly crash the backfiller? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Race Condition] At lines 208-212, finished_starting_versions is updated after upload, but if the progress update task reads between uploads, can it miss completed versions causing data loss on restart? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Duplicate Processing] If multiple workers receive the same transactions batch due to channel cloning, can they both insert the same starting_version into finished_starting_versions, causing duplicate uploads and storage corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Race Condition] At lines 223-233, the progress task checks and updates finished_starting_versions, but can concurrent worker insertions during this window cause the progress file to skip versions? (High)
